185791652.review:
"glub glub glub, ninguém tem paciência comigo..." Seu Atum começa a imitar Sardinha, como um eco absurdo na caverna vazia de sua própria existência, enquanto tenta conter o desnível de raiva que brota de sua insignificante resistência à verdade. "glub glub glub, ninguém tem paciência comigo..."

Só não te dou outra porque... Seu Atum, consumido pelo ódio e pela percepção do vazio inexorável que é a vida na Vila do Aquário, tenta, em vão, dominar suas emoções fugazes. Afinal, Sardinha é apenas um garoto de oito anos. Um garoto que, por mais irritante que pareça, não age por maldade, mas sim por instinto. Ele é uma criatura do acaso, largada ao vento e destinada a desaparecer, como todos os outros. Seu estômago vazio e os ossos à mostra são apenas lembretes de que, no grande esquema do cosmos, ninguém está realmente vivo.

Dias passam. O tempo, indiferente e cruel, avança sem propósito, como sempre fez e sempre fará. Bacalhau, guiado por uma curiosidade pueril e uma preocupação que mal consegue entender, aproxima-se de Seu Atum com a mesma expressão vazia que todos usam para fingir que há algo além do tédio eterno da Vila.

"Seu Atum, você viu o Sardinha? Faz tempo que ele não aparece..."

O homem respira fundo, mas suas palavras são engolidas pelo silêncio ensurdecedor da realidade. O que há para dizer? Que Sardinha, tão jovem e frágil, provavelmente sucumbiu à desnutrição, desaparecendo como poeira ao vento? Que, mesmo com todo seu riso e barulho, ele nunca importou, assim como nenhum deles importa? Seu Atum olha para Bacalhau. Ele hesita. No fundo, sabe que não há nada mais honesto a dizer do que:

"Não importa, Bacalhau. Nada disso importa."

Bacalhau, confuso, balança a cabeça e volta a brincar com sua boia. A Vila segue, repetindo-se em ciclos eternos, enquanto a sombra do nada cresce silenciosamente sobre todos.

185223828.review:
体验感屎的一批，新手教程跟没教的一样。马的为什么我要等上好几分钟才上一条鱼，中间还不能干其他事，你还得一直盯着鱼竿。任务花了一个多小时都还没搞定，就是钓不上指定的那条鱼，无语。。。。。别看游戏介绍，看着是挺好玩，还可以开船，但踏马的要等你到后期才能用，牢弟，你还得肝！

广告也是真恶心，动不动就弹出让你充钱的广告，差评👎。

这个游戏只适合中年玩家，听哥一句劝，别下这游戏，白瞎10gb的内存。最重要的是，他还要求你装一个反作弊系统，直接降低你cpu 30%的性能，狗屎一样。

不过有一说一，他的风景做挺好的，渔具和操作系统什么的很齐全，时间是跟着现实时间走的，不同地区有不同的时差，去不同地图钓鱼还得买渔证。作为的一名钓鱼佬，我表示这游戏还蛮真实的。

但是bug也是真的多，有一次鱼竿直接给我卡没了，还有为啥我想换个路亚都换不上去，也没告诉我为啥, 辣鸡。

餌釣りに関してはタナの調整と時間帯調整でルアーよりも早く多く釣れる。
釣れない時はとにかく時間が悪いので時間帯をスキップすると良い。

無課金でも貯まったゴールドで釣り場のライセンスを購入すれば条件なしで釣り放題になる。
ゲームは楽しいが課金欲がそそられないコンテンツのセールがうざったい事を除けば良質な釣りゲー。

184885202.review:
7/10 - Reel Fun, but Sometimes I’m Hooked on Rage

Fishing Planet is a fin-tastic simulator where you can live out your dreams of catching pixelated fish without ever leaving your couch. Cast your line, wait patiently (or not), and pray to the RNG gods that your virtual trout isn’t smarter than you. Spoiler: it probably is.

The graphics are scale-tacular, and the sound of water is oddly relaxing—until you miss a bite and snap. The grind can feel like you’re swimming upstream, and some of the best gear costs more than my real-life rod, but hey, that’s fishing, right?

If you’re hooked on fishing or just want to chill while yelling “WHY WON’T YOU BITE?!” at your screen, give it a go. It’s worth a cast.

184351830.review:
Although I was excited to try this game, I was ultimately very disappointed. Fishing Planet promised a realistic fishing experience, but unfortunately, it didn’t deliver. The graphics are decent, but the gameplay is boring and repetitive. Fishing feels frustrating, with unclear mechanics and long waiting times, which isn’t fun at all. On top of that, the game feels heavily focused on microtransactions, which only adds to the frustration, as progress without them is painfully slow.

What disappointed me the most was how the game failed to offer any real experience that would keep me hooked. It’s extremely slow-paced, and while some might enjoy its calm atmosphere, I found it dull.

If you’re looking for a game that will genuinely give you joy from fishing, I’d definitely recommend looking elsewhere. Fishing Planet was a waste of time for me.

Well there's obviously no fixing it. Better buy another one. Want to fish somewhere else besides some dinky little pond? That's going to cost money for a license. Got your license? Good now pay to travel there. Ok now you're there? forget anything? And don't get me started on the interface of the backpack, equiping items, and the shop. It took me about 2 days of playing before I finally figured out how everything works. Absolute trash. And good god do the devs try to shove microtransations down your throat. After every loading screen it throws an ad up to buy some crappy bundle. The only time it doesn't throw one up is when you first load into the game where it throws 3 pop ups back to back and then takes you to a glorified slot machine where it gives you a predatory free spin to entice you to spend money on the games premium currency after the first freebee. This game is not meant to be fun. It's meant to be as frustrating as it can so you will pay your'e hard earned money to skip the grind. Don't waste you're time on this dumpster fire of a game.
184075037.developer_response:
Thank you for sharing your feedback. We’re sorry to hear that your experience with the game hasn’t been enjoyable. Your concerns are valid, and we’d like to address a few of them:

Equipment Mechanics: The line strength vs. reel durability mechanic is designed to simulate the need for balanced gear setups, which mirrors real-life fishing to an extent. However, we understand this might not feel intuitive for some players, and we'll pass your feedback along to the team for consideration.

Travel and Licensing Costs: The travel and license system is meant to add a layer of strategy and progression, but we understand it can feel restrictive. Suggestions like adjusting costs or allowing a "free forget" option for items have been noted.

Interface: We are continuously working on improving the UI to make it more user-friendly. If you have specific suggestions on what could be improved, please let us know.

Microtransactions: The game is free-to-play, and optional bundles and premium features help support development. That said, your point about the frequency of ads and pop-ups is valid, and we'll look into balancing this better.

We truly appreciate your feedback, as it helps us understand what works and what doesn’t. If you decide to give the game another shot, we’d love to hear if any future updates improve your experience.

Thank you for trying Fishing Planet, and we hope to make it better for all players!

183971314.review:
心态比较复杂，本来想点不推荐的，不过这个游戏还算有些优点。
1.相对齐全的渔具种类，分类明确、搭配通俗易懂。
2.虽然一样有鱼口惩罚机制，但可以通过跳时间解决问题。此外本游戏所有鱼饵只要规格、颜色和种类用对了都能成功上鱼。休闲玩法基本不存在空竿。
3.体量小、优化尚可，不吃配置，低配机一样流畅运行。
4.每天签到可领低保，奖杯鱼特殊鱼多如喝水，基础鱼饵价格便宜，新手村时期暂时不用担心破产。
好了，现在说缺点和我个人对这个游戏所持的部分消极观点，开喷！
1.零氪玩家被迫爆肝，因为这个游戏强制玩家小杆拉大鱼，不然就扣经验。所以不买DLC的发育流程相当于坐大牢，所有发育路线僵硬且严重固化，不然要么卡等级要么卡经济。玩家只管充钱就好了，但官方运营考虑的就多了。
2.天价路费、奸商渔具，购物成本贵得要死，这个游戏里的鱼，经济价值仅和尺寸以及相应的等级挂钩，而不是和鱼种稀有程度挂钩。想要挣钱只能走固定的发育路线，不然钓小鱼手都按麻了，一个多小时挣不回来门票钱。但是这不代表你买的东西就坚固耐用，再贵的装备，耐久值一样咔咔掉，我都怀疑这游戏的水里掺了硫酸。不想被搬砖挣钱折磨的话只能氪金买礼包。游戏是免费的，但想要有体验就必须要付出相当的成本。
3.官方不作为，bug不修、外挂不封，一天天就知道出你那b礼包圈钱、对绿玩无故封号重拳出击。还有自2022年1月以来，官方工作室借着俄乌冲突疯狂炒作卖惨爆金币、你一个本来就不应该涉及任何分歧话题的钓鱼游戏，非得要渲染意识形态和国际政治问题，归根到底还是为了钱。成天哭哭啼啼地喊着自己团队里大部分身为乌克兰人有多惨，游戏动态都连着发了一大堆，怎么没见官方自一名开发团队成员参战阵亡之后继续回国填线啊（笑），买礼包和地图只会中饱那些坐在海外办公室里混吃混喝的游戏策划的私囊，根本救不了乌克兰人，别拿人道主义和国际主义道德绑架这个游戏的玩家。

hank you for sharing your honest feedback. We’re sorry to hear about your frustration, and we understand how challenging it can feel to get started. Here are a few points we’d like to address:

Beginner Experience: We acknowledge that the learning curve can be steep. While we have tutorials in place, it’s clear from your feedback that they may not be detailed or accessible enough. Improving the beginner experience is something we’re actively looking into.

Guides and Instructions: Many players do turn to external guides for more detailed help, but we agree that more in-game resources—such as clear instructions for setting up rods, using lures, or understanding game mechanics—would make the game more enjoyable for new players.

Grinding vs. Paying: The game is designed to offer both free and paid options, but we understand how the grind can feel overwhelming. We’ll share your feedback with the team to consider ways to make the progression more balanced.

We appreciate your feedback and take it seriously. If you decide to give Fishing Planet another shot in the future, we hope the updates and improvements make the experience more enjoyable for you.

Tight lines, and thank you for giving us a try!

I like most everything about the game EXCEPT how many XP points you need to advance once you've been playing a bit. 

I just got to level 48 and it takes 90 THOUSAND XP points to get to level 49, and who knows how many more to get to level 50. It shoots up every level. 

I'm about ready to quit. I think I'm going to call it 'game over' once done with Dnipro River in Ukraine. I wanted to fish Blue Crab, but that is a LIFETIME away at level 54. Looking at a HALF MILLION more XP to get there from level 48. That's a good 2500 more fish to catch at a bare minimum. At 100 fish per day it'll take the better part of a MONTH to get there.

That takes ALL the fun out of it... and I have a premium account with gives 50% extra XP AND I use light tackle and barbless hooks for increased XP, but it's just too much.

[quote]Warning: Microtransaction infested mobile app[/quote]

Fishing Planet is one of thousands of nasty mobile apps infesting the "free" section of Steam, but it's not really free.

But the offensive thing about this is the horrible, misleading presentation.  It's barely a game.

It's just a veneer wrapped around a nasty, predatory mobile app cash shop.

On pricing and value for gamers, this isn't really free as you're expected to pay up more money to unlock content/DLC so you can keep playing.  This is some nasty, predatory pricing and PC gamers don't like it.

Even after that, this is only free in a rudimentary sense... the developer has their hand out for $1307 USD worth of DLC to unlock the full game.  I'm not making this up.

There's no other way to put it; such pricing is absolutely toxic greed.  This is cancer.  It's a scam.  Avoid at all costs.

Free-to-Play Model: Fishing Planet is designed as a free-to-play game, allowing players to access the core experience without spending money. However, it also offers optional DLCs and microtransactions to enhance the experience for those who choose to invest.

In-Game Content: While the full range of content can appear overwhelming in cost when adding up all DLCs, it's worth noting that these are entirely optional. Players can progress and enjoy the game without purchasing any paid content, though it may require more time and effort.

Feedback on Pricing: Your concerns about the perceived high cost of DLCs and the impact of monetization on gameplay are valid. Feedback like yours helps us reflect on our approach to ensure the game remains accessible and enjoyable for all players, regardless of their spending preferences.

Gaming Experience: We strive to create a realistic and engaging fishing simulation, and while it may not meet everyone's expectations, it has been appreciated by a community of dedicated anglers. That said, we acknowledge that there’s always room for improvement, particularly in balancing free and paid content.

We value your feedback and encourage you to share specific suggestions on how we can make the game better. Constructive criticism helps us grow and ensures a better experience for all players.

Tight lines, and thank you for giving Fishing Planet a try.
